related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@johnkennyuk) is experiencing issues linking their Github and Google accounts.
* The current account linking process is not working properly.
* User prefers to keep their Google account as the main account.
* User wants to wait for the new sign-in system to be implemented before attempting to link again.

**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking flow is not functioning correctly.
* User's Google and Github email addresses have a capitalization discrepancy.
* The old auth service provider has limitations causing inconsistencies.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark (@mark-at-pieces) reset the user's Github account multiple times.
* User was advised to temporarily disable email privacy settings on Github.
* User was advised to adjust the capitalization of their email address on Github.
* Mark confirmed that a new sign-in system is being developed and will be released in early/mid March.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is unresolved as of February 23rd, 2025.
* The new sign-in system is still under development and expected to be released in early/mid March.
* User will wait for the new system before attempting to link their accounts again.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue is likely caused by a capitalization discrepancy in the user's email addresses.
* The old auth service provider is being replaced, which should resolve the account linking issues.

### Software

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: `Unable to Launch Pieces on Windows 10`

**Key points:**

* The user, ThemePark, is unable to launch Pieces on Windows 10.
* The issue appears to be related to a timing conflict between PiecesOS and the Pieces Desktop app both trying to launch on startup.
* ThemePark has confirmed that PiecesOS is configured to launch on startup.
* ThemePark is also experiencing an issue where Pieces for VS Code crashes and displays a non-dismissable overlay message.

**Problems identified:**

* Timing conflict between PiecesOS and Pieces Desktop app causing launch issues.
* Non-dismissable overlay message appearing after Pieces for VS Code crashes.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mack, a Pieces support team member, suggested switching the startup app to either PiecesOS or Pieces Desktop instead of both.
* ThemePark needs to find a way to dismiss the non-dismissable overlay message.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue with the timing conflict is still ongoing.
* ThemePark is still experiencing the non-dismissable overlay message and is looking for a solution.

**Additional notes:**

* ThemePark is running Pieces for VS Code.
* The non-dismissable overlay message appears approximately 10 minutes after launching Pieces for VS Code.
* Restarting the computer is the only known way to remove the non-dismissable overlay message.

Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Summary:

**Key Points:**

* User (@rohanrathi99) reported issues connecting to cloud services and local models in PiecesOS.
* Support team member (@mark-at-pieces) requested logs and suggested scheduling a call for further investigation.
* User shared logs and scheduled a call.

**Problems Identified:**

* Connectivity issues with cloud services.
* Problems with local models (likely due to hardware constraints).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No OpenApi key should be used for cloud LLMs.
* Use a smaller local LLM if hardware constraints are present.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issues resolved.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## GitHub Issue Summary: Ollama Server Errors on Pieces OS

**Key Points:**

* Ollama Server on Pieces OS throwing Cuda errors related to `cublas64_12.dll`.
* Problem occurs despite reinstalling both Ollama and Pieces OS multiple times.
* Possible causes:
    * Incomplete/broken installation of Ollama via Pieces.
    * Race condition between Pieces OS and Ollama App startup.
* User workaround: Disable Pieces OS launch on sign-in.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Reinstalling Ollama using `winget uninstall` and `OllamaSetup.exe`.
* Cleaning up PATH environment variables.
* Investigating Pieces OS startup sequence and potential race conditions (version 11.1.2 update).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User reports problem persists even after updating to version 11.1.2.
* Further troubleshooting and investigation needed.

**Open Question:**

* Does Pieces OS have functionality to detect and utilize an external Ollama App instance?

**Next Steps:**

* User to update again and provide feedback.
* Investigate further if problem persists.
* Consider potential future improvements to address external Ollama App integration.

Desktop Application

Windows

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Summary:

**Key Points:**

* User (@rohanrathi99) reported issues connecting to cloud services and local models in PiecesOS.
* Support team member (@mark-at-pieces) requested logs and suggested scheduling a call for further investigation.
* User shared logs and scheduled a call.

**Problems Identified:**

* Connectivity issues with cloud services.
* Problems with local models (likely due to hardware constraints).

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* No OpenApi key should be used for cloud LLMs.
* Use a smaller local LLM if hardware constraints are present.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issues resolved.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of Pieces OS launch issues:** This is a critical issue affecting multiple users and hindering their ability to use the software. Focus on identifying the root causes, whether it's OneDrive conflicts, duplicate installations, or other factors, and provide clear solutions.

**Improve Ollama integration and troubleshooting:** Address the recurring issues with Ollama server integration, including Cuda errors and installation problems. Provide clearer instructions, investigate potential conflicts, and ensure compatibility with different hardware configurations.

**Enhance communication and documentation:** Provide users with more detailed guidance on troubleshooting common issues, including network connectivity problems, account linking errors, and software conflicts. Update documentation and FAQs to reflect these solutions.

**Investigate and address JetBrains plugin bugs:** Resolve the reported issues with horizontal scrolling, cursor visibility, and connectivity within the JetBrains plugin to ensure a seamless user experience.

**Gather more detailed user feedback:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive information when reporting issues, including system specifications, steps to reproduce the problem, and any error messages encountered. This will help in faster diagnosis and resolution.

**Consider implementing a system for detecting and utilizing external Ollama App instances:** This would allow users to leverage their existing Ollama installations and potentially avoid conflicts with the Pieces OS built-in version.

**Investigate the feasibility of a more robust account linking system:** Address the long-standing issue of account linking difficulties, potentially by revamping the linking process or exploring alternative authentication methods.

**Continue monitoring and addressing issues related to new features:** As new features are released, pay close attention to user feedback and support tickets to identify and address any teething problems promptly.

**Proactively communicate known issues and workarounds:** Maintain a public-facing list of known issues and workarounds to keep users informed and minimize frustration while waiting for permanent solutions.

**Analyze support ticket trends:** Regularly analyze support ticket data to identify recurring issues, common pain points, and areas where documentation or software improvements are needed. This data-driven approach will help prioritize development efforts and enhance the overall user experience.
